ygData.subject: Re: Bard Equipment Question
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The Crown of the Froglok Kings is not dropped at the Live tower. The Froglok Crusader and Priest spawn there.  The crown is dropped by the Froglok King
ygData.messageBody:
> > the Crown of the Froglok Kings, and
>
> I heard of a L40 full group holding the tower on live side.
> Anything less than that I think you'd be asking for trouble.
>

The Crown of the Froglok Kings is not dropped at the Live tower. The Froglok
Crusader and Priest spawn there. The crown is dropped by the Froglok King
(who else?!) which is a tough camp. At lvl 40 I'd rather do the tower -
though King may be doable by a lvl 40 group. Hrm.. I do need to build up my
50 xp buffer...better hit the throne room!


> > the Lambent Helm?
>
> of the two pieces for this, the opaline helm is carried on
> deepwater goblins. They are much harder than they look.
> During Sylly's event last week, two deepwater goblins were
> pulled and Sylly, A level 50 cleric, and myself were almost
> slain. Nasty critters. Again, if you happened to loot a
> helm on the first try when L50s were farting around pulling
> the DWs, then you got lucky. We killed 5 that night, and
> saw no helm.
>

Use Charm. =) Charmed DW Gobs make nice pets. I also find it's a nice way
to avoid getting nuked by them. When they start casting and your charm hits
them their nuke bounces off you harmlessly.

> Which is easiest -> hardest? (minus the luck factor)
>
> Lambent, Crested, Froglok, in that order I think.
>
> HARDEST:
> Froglok requires you penetrate a fairly tough dungeon, and
> engage in a fairly decent fight with the king and guards.
>
> HARDER:
> Crested helm, the Caitliff isn't hard, he's just hard to get
> to drop the helm.
>
> HARD:
> Lambent helm, practice and patience. No dungeons, easy zone
> if things go wrong, most pieces acquirable.
>
> Harmonic.
